data.title: How does tolerance work? A conversation with former Federal President Joachim Gauck
data.meta_description: Video recording of the panel discussion on 10 November 2021
data.text:
Nov 11, 2021

On Wednesday, November 10, 2021, former German President Dr. h.c. mult. Joachim Gauck visited the Tolerance Research Unit Kiel (KFT) at Kiel University. In the evening, he discussed with Bernd Simon, Professor of Social and Political Psychology and Head of KFT, and Hartmut Rosenau, Professor of Theology, the meaning of tolerance, where and how the limits of tolerance are to be drawn, and whether and when there could be a need for intolerance. Rolf Fischer, former State Secretary and Chairman of the KFT Advisory Board, opened the event. Professor Ilka Parchmann, Kiel Universityâ€™s former vice-president, led through the discussion.
